title: matplotlib elementwise vs scalar comparison
body:
Hello,

congrats on this awesome tool!

I get this warning from the output. I guess it's ok for now, but it may become an error as soon as matplotlib gets updated:

Step7: Output result
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/matplotlib/collections.py:571: FutureWarning: elementwise comparison failed; returning scalar instead, but in the future will perform elementwise comparison
  if self._edgecolors == str('face'):
output wig files ...

title: Is this repository a perfect replica of the MAnorm package, but in python?
body: Is there a publication linked to this repository?

title: Could you document the test directory?
body: In the test directory, there are probably files you use to test this repository. Could you attach the associated commands?

title: Does this code work?
body:
@semal Below, I tested this library as well as the old MAnorm (MAnorm.py, the second experiment below)

MAnormFast doesn't work but MAnorm does. Why is that? 

### Using MAnormFast:

```
(venv) lenail@fraenkel-node17:~/MAnorm$ MAnormFast -v --p1 k4_DOP_714_output_peaks.xls --r1 k4_DOP_714_mm9_noMT_bowtie2.bed --p2 k4_SST_714_output_peaks.xls --r2 k4_SST_714_mm9_noMT_bowtie2.bed --s1 50 --s2 50 -o k4_DOPvsSST_714

# ARGUMENT LIST:
# numerator peaks file=k4_DOP_714_output_peaks.xls
# denominator peaks file=k4_SST_714_output_peaks.xls
# numerator reads file=k4_DOP_714_mm9_noMT_bowtie2.bed
# denominator reads file=k4_SST_714_mm9_noMT_bowtie2.bed
# shift size of numerator reads=50
# shift size of denominator reads=50
# extension size of peak=1000
# min summit to summit distance=500
# output folder name=k4_DOPvsSST_714

Reading Data, please wait for a while...
Step1: Classify the 2 peaks by overlap
k4_DOP_714_output_peaks: 0(unique) 0(common)
k4_SST_714_output_peaks: 0(unique) 0(common)
Step2: Random overlap testing, test time is 5
fold change: mean=0.000000, std=0.000000
Step3: Merging common peaks
merged peaks: 0
@Error: No common peaks!!
```

### Using MAnorm.py:

